intro.description:
In this tutorial, you learn how edit an existing frame animation. To follow the tutorial, you must have an external vector editor installed in your computer.
If the views you need to perform this tutorial are not visible, select Window -> Show View and select the view you want.
Follow the tutorial steps in order.After each step, move to the next step by clicking the button located at the bottom of the step: Click to Perform (if you want the step to be performed automatically), Click to Skip (if you want to perform the step manually) or Click to Complete (if no automatisation is available). If you do not use the buttons to move between steps, the automated tutorial functions become inavailable. To start this tutorial, click the Click to Begin button below.

item.title: Create a new theme.
item.description: In the menu bar, select File -> Create New Theme. A New Theme window opens. In the Theme name field, enter Tutorial5. Click Finish. Click Click to Perform to create a new Theme automatically.

item.title: Select the animated Browser Connecting icon.
item.description: In the Resource view, select Icons -> Miscellaneous Icons -> Browser Connecting (Animated). Click Click to Perform to select the animated icon automatically.

item.title: Open the Entity graphics editor view.
item.description: In the Browser Connecting (Animated) view, select the Edit/Animate selected elements symbol. Entity graphics editor view opens. Click Click to Perform to open the Entity graphics editor automatically.

item.title: Edit the animation.
item.description: Select the third frame and click the red cross to delete the frame from the animation. Click the white paper sheet to add an empty frame to the animation. Right-click a desired frame to edit it in an external editor. Edit the frame in the external editor. Save the frame and exit the external editor.

item.title: Time the animation.
item.description: Set the length of each animated frame to be of the same length by clicking the Distribute Animate Time button. Enter 150 for the time. Change the length of the third frame by right-clicking the frame and selecting Set animate time. Enter the length as 600 and click OK. Click Click to Perform to time the animation automatically.

item.title: Preview the animation.
item.description: Click the green play button. Click Click to Perform to preview the animation automatically.

item.title: Save the theme.
item.description: Select File -> Save. Click Click to Perform to save the theme automatically.
